intro: Solanum nudum var. micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, yellow berries that contain toxic alkaloids. This species is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
